intro: Sium sisarum var. angustum, commonly known as narrowleaf waterparsnip, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its slender, angular stems and distinctive foliage make it identifiable in its natural habitat.
